title: Pre-0.3.0 changes
body:
- Fix an intra-doc link.
- Add feature flags to docs.rs documentation.

title: Update jubjub subtree
body: Pulls in https://github.com/zkcrypto/jubjub/commit/38d38af3b792d2c55d815d214a7cd157dc8f71ad

title: Edwards naming cleanups
body: Fixes #275.

title: Migrate to bls12_381 and jubjub crates
body: Closes #170. Closes #171.

title: Decrypt sapling output description given OCK
body:
This PR slightly modifies the sapling recovery functionality to give users of this library the ability to decrypt a sapling output given they only have their `ock`, instead of the `ovk`.

`prf_ock` is also changed to public, to allow library users the ability to generate an ock for later usage.

title: Refactor fixes
body:
- `pairing::Engine` now requires G1 and G2 to be prime-order groups.
- We no longer use `Choice::unwrap_u8`.

title: Update bls12_381 subtree
body: Pulls in https://github.com/zkcrypto/bls12_381/commit/d0ea5d4958cae999dea1800207704171aa07a9ef

title: Updates to group traits
body: Changes that have arisen from review of #245.

title: CI: Build zcash_proofs against WASM targets
body:
This ensures that we don't introduce any regressions for WASM consumers.

Closes zcash/zcash#4655.

title: ZIP212 implementation
body: Closes https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/issues/260

title: bellman: add VerificationError
body:
This adds a distinct VerificationError type to the crate and changes
`verify_proof` to return `Result<(), VerificationError>` rather than
`Result<bool, SynthesisError>`.  This is significantly safer, because it avoids
the need to mix pattern-matching logic with boolean logic (the cause of
RUSTSEC-2019-0004).

title: zcash_proofs: Add LocalProver::bundled
body: Requires the `bundled-prover` feature for the `zcash_proofs` crate, which enables the `wagyu-zcash-parameters` crate and adds around 50 MiB to the overall binary size. That crate bundles the same Sapling parameter files we normally obtain from disk, so we constrain them to match the same hard-coded hashes.

title: Equihash tests
body:
Migrated from:

- https://github.com/zcash/zcash/blob/master/src/test/equihash_tests.cpp
- https://github.com/zcash/zcash/blob/master/src/gtest/test_equihash.cpp
- https://github.com/zcash/zcash/pull/1487

title: Move Equihash verifier into equihash crate
body: This enables it to be used independently from `zcash_primitives`, such as in `zebrad`.

title: zcash_client_sqlite crate
body:
My [`note-spending-v7`](https://github.com/str4d/librustzcash/tree/note-spending-v7) branch is pretty stable at this point, and now being depended on more widely (after the ECC wallet was recently open-sourced). I rebased my branch on current master to fix merge conflicts (due to recent refactors), but it's otherwise unaltered.

Closes #71.

title: Implement group and pairing traits for bls12_381 and jubjub crates
body: Closes #163. Closes #167. Closes #169.

title: pairing: Bound Engine::Gt on Group instead of Field
New group traits
body:
This implements the current version of https://github.com/zkcrypto/group/issues/6, and provides APIs that we can implement for the `bls12_381` and `jubjub` crates.

Closes #161.

title: Set activation heights for Heartwood network upgrade
pairing: Refactor traits to reflect bls12_381 crate API
Replace E: ScalarEngine with Scalar: PrimeField
body: Instead of imposing the requirement that bellman users explicitly specify an engine for every proving system, we allow the Rust type system to figure it out for us. An engine is specifically useful in places where we require defined relationships between several types; `ff::ScalarEngine` only has one type, and thus any usage of it can be trivially replaced by an explicit `Scalar` type. This is also more readable :)

title: Lint fixes
body: Addresses lints that are [visible when checking with nightly](https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/pull/205/files) (rather than the current MSRV of 1.39).

title: group: CurveAffine and CurveProjective trait refactor
group crate refactoring
body:
The new `Group` trait represents a cryptographic group with a large prime-order subgroup and a small cofactor. The `PrimeGroup` trait further constrains the group to have a cofactor of one. `CurveProjective` now primarily contains EC-specific functionality.

Part of #161.

title: Hard-code Sapling circuit hashes in zcash_proofs crate
body:
Define the spend_hash and output_hash circuit hashes as constants in the load_parameters function, so we don't have to take them as function arguments.

Closes #106

title: ff: More trait refactoring
body: Addresses trait-related comments from @ebfull on #227.

title: Implement ff traits for bls12_381 and jubjub crates
body: Closes #160 and #166.

title: Remove ff::PrimeFieldRepr

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body: Closes #159.

title: Expose the `hash` and `n` fields of Transparent Outputs
body: Zecwallet Lite currently depends on a fork of `librustzcash`, which has some minor additions to the upstream `librustzcash`. It would be awesome if `librustzcash` added these changes, so I can depend directly on `librustzcash`.

title: Add binding signature only if needed
body: Fixes #220 .

title: Remove Cargo.lock
body: Now that the `librustzcash` crate has been removed from the repository and workspace, there are no crates that generate binary artifacts, and cargo ignores `Cargo.lock` when publishing library crates.

title: Remove librustzcash crate
body:
This crate now lives in https://github.com/zcash/zcash, which is the
sole intended consumer of the C FFI.

title: UX refactors for proving-related APIs

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body:
Most of this is much-needed refactoring, but there are a few small usability improvements:

- `Builder::add_sapling_spend` now takes a `MerklePath` directly, thanks to the newly-added `MerklePath::root(leaf: Node)`.
- `Builder::build` now takes `impl TxProver` by reference, so the caller may reuse it.

title: CI: Use stable Rust release for code coverage
body: Fixes an issue where cargo-tarpaulin failed to build the crate on 1.37.0, but the crate itself builds fine with that version.

title: Addressing some trivial Rust option/iterator lints
body:
Written while reading some of the code. Opinions on this are loose,
happy to accomodate in review.

title: Clippy cleanups

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body: Making progress towards being able to enable clippy lints in CI.

title: Speed up Field::invert and SqrtField::sqrt in ff_derive with addition chains
body: Currently uses the Bergeron-Berstel-Brlek-Duboc algorithm (via the `addchain` crate) to generate addition chains, which speeds up `Field::invert` and `SqrtField::sqrt` for `pairing::bls12_381` by around 15%.

title: Constant-time field inversion in ff_derive using pow_vartime
body: Part of #159.

title: Move Group operations to operator-backed traits

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body: Part of #161.

title: ff::Field::pow_vartime and no_std support

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body: Part of #159.

title: Constant-time APIs for ff::Field::[invert, sqrt]

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body:
The `pairing::bls12_381` and `zcash_primitives::jubjub` implementations are **not** constant-time, but will be replaced by the `bls12_381` and `jubjub` implementations which are.

The `ff_derive` implementation of `sqrt` is constant-time (having been ported from `bls12_381::Scalar`), but the `invert` implementation is **not** constant-time yet.

Part of #159.

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body: Part of #159.

title: Move Field operations to operator-backed traits

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

body:
The `ff_derive`, `pairing`, `zcash_primitives::jubjub`, and `bellman` `dummy_engine` changes are minimally implemented on top of the existing `*_assign()` functions.

Part of #159.

title: New BLS12-381 and Jubjub implementations
body: This PR brings in `0.1.0` of the `bls12_381` crate, and `0.3.0` of the `jubjub` crate.

title: Pass bellman's multicore feature flag through to zcash_proofs
body: This enables someone using zcash_proofs to disable multicore.

title: MMR API cleanups
body: Addresses the remaining comments from #118.

title: zcash_client_backend::decrypt_transaction
body: Part of #156.

title: Network upgrade awareness
body: Closes #152.

title: rename bvk to cv_sum
body:
Signed-off-by: Gregory Hill <gregorydhill@outlook.com>

Closes #79

title: Compile Fix: Add missing sighash declaration
body: The `sighash` variable was not defined

title: Move code coverage from Travis CI to Actions
body: This should make both coverage generation and Travis CI more reliable (the latter shouldn't time out anymore).

title: Doc link fixes
body: Fixes a lint.

title: Fix rand_os warning in tests
body: Warnings were originally fixed in #134. This warning was introduced in #114, but it wasn't spotted because there was no merge conflict.

title: Implement sorting for TxIDs
body: Implement PartialOrd and Ord for TxIds, which allows for sorting TxIDs, which is useful for detecting duplicates (~`HashSet` and~ `Vec::dedup` need sorted lists)

title: Specify rand_core >= 0.5.1 for OsRng import.
body:
Fixes issue introduced by #134. `rand_core` 0.5.0 does not export `OsRng` in the crate root but 0.5.1 does.

@NikVolf

title: Unit tests for key encodings
body: Closes #119.

title: Panic if spending_key is given a seed shorter than 32 bytes
body:
This enforces the MUST requirement in ZIP 32. A panic is used instead of
an error because this should be considered an implementation error.
Ideally the type system would prevent this from occurring at all.

Closes #125.

title: More crate updates
body: Includes a fix for a `bellman` compile bug introduced in #104.

title: MMR trees API
body:
according to emerging spec here: https://github.com/zcash/zips/pull/220

Not sure it belongs here or to the separate lib!

The main design goals of this mmr implementation were
1. Avoid database callbacks. As it is implemented, calling side must just smartly pre-load MMR nodes from the database (about log2(tree length) for append, twice as much for deletion).

2. Reuse as much code/logic between rust and c++ clients.

3. Close to zero memory consumption.

title: Add code coverage with cargo-tarpaulin and Codecov
librustzcash: Fix typo in Windows parameter init; Correctly map sprout_path. Includes a GitHub actions improvement
body: Introduced in #98.

title: Edition 2018 clean up
body:
This PR runs `cargo fix --edition` and `cargo fix --edition-idioms` on all of the modules which needed it, and includes some warning cleanup along the way. The folders  `zcash_primitives/benches/...` and `pairing/benches/...` were omitted when running the fix because they depend on unstable features, so it is possible that they no longer work. @ebfull suggested updating the benchmarks to use https://docs.rs/criterion/0.2.11/criterion/ which could be done as part of this PR, but might make more sense to be done as follow up.

Closes #97.

title: Add a GitHub Actions workflow
body: Enables running tests on Windows and macOS in addition to Ubuntu (which Travis CI provides).

title: Fix off-by-one so pedersen_hash doesn't consume too many generators.
body: Currently, `circuit::pedersen_hash::pedersen_hash` always consumes one too many generators because `segment_generators.next()` is called before checking `bits.next()`.

title: PaymentAddress encapsulation
body: Closes #102.

title: Add P2PKH transparent input support to transaction::Builder
body: Enabled by the `transparent-inputs` feature.

title: cargo fmt
body: This PR also updates Travis CI to require formatting.

title: Refactor to remove sapling-crypto
body:
The modules within `sapling-crypto` have been split across the `bellman`, `zcash_primitives`, and `zcash_proofs` crates.

Part of #41. Closes #55.

title: Make initialization of sprout validation key optional
body:
This makes the C interface behave like `zcash_proofs` and allows to
init the library without downloading the heavy sprout parameters.
In the special case where `librustzcash_init_zksnark_params` is called
with the sprout arguments path set to NULL and length set to 0, the
arguments are passed as None to `load_parameters`.

Closes #85.

title: Bring in QED-it Tests
body:
This PR was originally submitted here: https://github.com/zcash-hackworks/sapling-crypto/pull/101

This pulls in a bunch of tests QED-it wrote during their audit that were spread across many branches in their [sapling-crypto-internal](https://github.com/QED-it/sapling-crypto-internal) repository. I've left their history intact so the best way to review it is to just look at the final diff, except for...

- [This commit](https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/pull/93/commits/f6f5f586aaae5d652bcd082ea82d3e0de24ac60f), which includes changes outside of tests, and
- [This commit](https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/pull/93/commits/335230448dec0c2ccd4aa230a053866b4ffedf9d), which is my attempt to fix the broken linear relation testing in that commit (the check in that commit effectively just checks that p1 != p2 again, not what it was intended to do).
- I deleted a [`find_group_hash` test](https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/pull/93/commits/13bf8d5f0f9bb221cf5bd2a88e9c0b4a46d077ed) since it didn't look like it was doing anything useful, and I don't want merging to block on me figuring out how to implement that test well. Raise a separate issue and assign me if you would like some `find_group_hash` unit tests!

I did *not* bring in [this change to the circuit code](https://github.com/QED-it/sapling-crypto-internal/commit/31781e844fe976649c817ed3fc32c683aa383c76), because I don't understand it. I also did not bring in a bunch of changes to comments and variable renamings in [the aurel_comments branch](https://github.com/QED-it/sapling-crypto-internal/compare/aurel_comments) and [the sum_bug branch](https://github.com/QED-it/sapling-crypto-internal/compare/sum_bug), but I did bring in the new tests from those branches.

title: Transaction builder
body: Supports Sapling spends, Sapling outputs, and transparent (P2PKH and P2SH) outputs.

title: Upgrade rand crate dependency to 0.7
body:
Also moves to `rand_core` where possible, to reduce the dependency surface.

Closes #60.

title: Make some methods pub for use in External Wallet Generators
body: Make some methods in DiversifierIndex and DiversifierKey pub so external wallet generators (like zecpaperwallet) can use them

title: Sapling address encodings
body: The `zip32` crate is also converted into a module of `zcash_primitives`.

title: Migrate to blake2b_simd and blake2s_simd crates
body:
The primary reason for migrating is that these crates provide APIs for
setting the personalisation string. This enables us to depend solely on
published crates, and thus publish our own crates. (In order for a crate
to be published, it can't depend on unpublished ones.)

The SIMD implementations are ported from libsodium.

Closes #67.

title: Closes #52. Fix test error "attempt to shift right with overflow".
body: Use wrapping function to directly disable integer overflow protection.

title: Place bellman multicore operations behind a (default) feature flag
body: When the `multicore` feature is disabled, an alternate implementation of the multicore operations is used that reduces the parallelization to 1 (preventing sharding of workloads), and immediately blocks on all operations.
